CreateDomain.document: This API is used to add a domain.
CreateDomain.name: Adds a domain

CreateDomainAlias.document: This API is used to create a domain alias.
CreateDomainAlias.name: Creates a domain alias

CreateDomainBatch.document: This API is used to bulk add domains.
CreateDomainBatch.name: Bulk adds domains

CreateDomainGroup.document: This API is used to create a domain group.
CreateDomainGroup.name: Creates a domain group

CreatePackageOrder.document: This API is used to enable a paid plan on the international website.
CreatePackageOrder.name: Create an international site package order

CreateRecord.document: This API is used to add a record.
CreateRecord.name: Adds a record

CreateRecordBatch.document: This API is used to bulk add records.
CreateRecordBatch.name: Bulk adds records

CreateRecordGroup.document: This API is used to add a record group.
CreateRecordGroup.name: Adds a record group

DeleteDomain.document: This API is used to delete a domain.
DeleteDomain.name: Deletes a domain

DeleteDomainAlias.document: This API is used to delete a domain alias.
DeleteDomainAlias.name: Deletes a domain alias

DeleteDomainBatch.document: This API is used to batch delete domains.
DeleteDomainBatch.name: Batch deletes domains

DeleteRecord.document: This API is used to delete a record.
DeleteRecord.name: Deletes a record

DeleteRecordGroup.document: This API is used to delete a record group.
DeleteRecordGroup.name: Deletes a record group

DeleteShareDomain.document: This API is used to unshare a domain.
DeleteShareDomain.name: Unshares a domain

DescribeDomain.document: This API is used to get the information of a domain.
DescribeDomain.name: Gets the information of a domain

DescribeDomainAliasList.document: This API is used to get the list of domain aliases.
DescribeDomainAliasList.name: Gets the list of domain aliases

DescribeDomainGroupList.document: This API is used to get the list of domain groups.
DescribeDomainGroupList.name: Gets the list of domain groups

DescribeDomainList.document: This API is used to get the list of domains.
DescribeDomainList.name: Gets the list of domains

DescribeDomainLogList.document: This API is used to get the log of a domain.
DescribeDomainLogList.name: Gets the log of a domain

DescribeDomainPurview.document: This API is used to get the permissions of a domain.
DescribeDomainPurview.name: Gets the permissions of a domain

DescribeDomainShareInfo.document: This API is used to get the domain sharing information.
DescribeDomainShareInfo.name: Gets the domain sharing information

DescribeRecord.document: This API is used to get the information of a record.
DescribeRecord.name: Gets the information of a record

DescribeRecordGroupList.document: This API is used to query the list of DNS record groups.
DescribeRecordGroupList.name: Queries the list of DNS record groups

DescribeRecordLineList.document: This API is used to get the split zones allowed by the domain level.
DescribeRecordLineList.name: Gets the split zones allowed by the domain level

DescribeRecordList.document: This API is used to get the DNS records of a domain.
DescribeRecordList.name: Gets DNS records of a domain

DescribeRecordType.document: This API is used to get the record type allowed by the domain level.
DescribeRecordType.name: Gets the record type allowed by the domain level

DescribeSubdomainAnalytics.document: This API is used to collect statistics on the DNS query volume of a subdomain. It helps you understand the traffic and time period distribution and allows you to view statistics in the last three months. It is available only for domains under a paid plan.
DescribeSubdomainAnalytics.name: Collects statistics on the DNS query volume of a subdomain

ModifyDomainLock.document: This API is used to lock a domain.
ModifyDomainLock.name: Locks a domain

ModifyDomainOwner.document: This API is used to transfer ownership of a domain.
ModifyDomainOwner.name: Transfers ownership of a domain

ModifyDomainRemark.document: This API is used to set the remarks of a domain.
ModifyDomainRemark.name: Sets the remarks of a domain

ModifyDomainStatus.document: This API is used to modify the status of a domain.
ModifyDomainStatus.name: Modifies the status of a domain

ModifyDomainUnlock.document: This API is used to unlock a domain.
ModifyDomainUnlock.name: Unlocks a domain

ModifyRecord.document: This API is used to modify a record.
ModifyRecord.name: Modifies a record

ModifyRecordBatch.document: This API is used to bulk modify records.
ModifyRecordBatch.name: Bulk modifies records

ModifyRecordGroup.document: This API is used to modify a record group.
ModifyRecordGroup.name: Modifies a record group

ModifyRecordRemark.document: This API is used to set the remarks of a record.
ModifyRecordRemark.name: Sets the remarks of a record

ModifyRecordStatus.document: This API is used to modify the DNS record status.
ModifyRecordStatus.name: Sets the record status

ModifyRecordToGroup.document: This API is used to add a record to a group.
ModifyRecordToGroup.name: Adds a record to a group

members.document: Record type. For more information, see the `DescribeRecordType` API.
members.name: RecordType

members.document: Record value.
members.name: Value

members.document: Subdomain (host record), which is `@` by default.
members.name: SubDomain

members.document: Split zone of the DNS record. For more information, see the `DescribeRecordLineList` API. If neither `RecordLine` nor `RecordLineId` is specified, the default split zone will be used.
members.name: RecordLine

members.document: Split zone ID of the DNS record. If both `RecordLine` and `RecordLineId` are specified, `RecordLineId` will be used.
members.name: RecordLineId

members.document: The record weight (not supported).
members.name: Weight

members.document: MX record value. It is `0` by default for non-MX records and required for MX records.
members.name: MX

members.document: TTL value of the record, which is `600` by default.
members.name: TTL

members.document: Record status (not supported). Valid values: `0` (disabled); `1` (enabled). Default value: `1`.
members.name: Enabled

members.document: Record remarks (not supported).
members.name: Remark

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Domain
members.name: Domain

members.document: Record type, which is obtained through the record type API. The value contains uppercase letters, such as `A`.
members.name: RecordType

members.document: Record split zone, which is obtained through the record split zone API.
members.name: RecordLine

members.document: Record value, such as `IP : 200.200.200.200`, `CNAME : cname.dnspod.com`, and `MX : mail.dnspod.com`.
members.name: Value

members.document: Domain ID. The `DomainId` parameter has a higher priority than `Domain`. If `DomainId` is passed in, `Domain` will be ignored.
members.name: DomainId

members.document: Host record such as `www`. If it is not passed in, it will be `@` by default.
members.name: SubDomain

members.document: Split zone ID, which is obtained through the record split zone API. The value is a string such as `10=1`. The `RecordLineId` parameter has a higher priority than `RecordLine`. If both of them are passed in, `RecordLineId` will be used first.
members.name: RecordLineId

members.document: MX priority, which is required for an MX record and will take effect if the record type is MX. Value range: 1–20.
members.name: MX

members.document: TTL. Value range: 1–604800. The minimum value varies by domain level.
members.name: TTL

members.document: Weight information, which is an integer between 0 and 100. It is supported only for enterprise VIP domains. `0` indicates not to pass in this parameter, i.e., not to set the weight.
members.name: Weight

members.document: Initial status of the record. Valid values: ENABLE, DISABLE. Default value: ENABLE. If `DISABLE` is passed in, the DNS record won't take effect, and the limit on round-robin DNS won't be verified.
members.name: Status

members.document: Record ID
members.name: RecordId

members.document:
Domain level.
+ Original plan. Valid values: `D_FREE` (Free Plan); `D_PLUS` (Individual Plus Plan); `D_EXTRA` (Enterprise 1 Plan); `D_EXPERT` (Enterprise 2 Plan); `D_ULTRA` (Enterprise 3 Plan).
+ New plan. Valid values: `DP_FREE` (Free Version); `DP_PLUS` (Professional); `DP_EXTRA` (Enterprise Basic); `DP_EXPERT` (Enterprise); `DP_ULTRA` (Ultimate).
members.name: DomainGrade

members.document: The domain ID. `DomainId` takes priority over `Domain`. If `DomainId` is passed in, `Domain` is ignored. You can view all `Domain` and `DomainId` values via the `DescribeDomainList` API.
members.name: DomainId

members.document: List of split zones.
members.name: LineList

members.document: List of split zone groups.
members.name: LineGroupList

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The domain for which DNS records are to be obtained.
members.name: Domain

members.document: The ID of the domain whose DNS records are requested. If `DomainId` is passed in, `Domain` is ignored. You can view all `Domain` and `DomainId` values via the `DescribeDomainList` API.
members.name: DomainId

members.document: The host header of a DNS record. If this parameter is passed in, only the DNS record corresponding to this host header will be returned.
members.name: Subdomain

members.document: The type of DNS record, such as A, CNAME, NS, AAAA, explicit URL, implicit URL, CAA, or SPF record.
members.name: RecordType

members.document: The name of the split zone for which DNS records are requested. You can view split zones allowed by this domain via the `DescribeRecordLineList` API.
members.name: RecordLine

members.document: The ID of the split zone for which DNS records are requested. If `RecordLineId` is passed in, `RecordLine` is ignored. You can view split zones allowed by this domain via the `DescribeRecordLineList` API.
members.name: RecordLineId

members.document: The group ID passed in to get DNS records in the group.
members.name: GroupId

members.document: The keyword for searching for DNS records. Host headers and record values are supported.
members.name: Keyword

members.document: The sorting field. Available values: `name`, `line`, `type`, `value`, `weight`, `mx`, and `ttl,updated_on`.
members.name: SortField

members.document: The sorting type. Valid values: `ASC` (ascending, default), `DESC` (descending).
members.name: SortType

members.document: The offset. Default value: `0`.
members.name: Offset

members.document: The limit. It defaults to 100 and can be up to 3,000.
members.name: Limit

members.document: The record count info.
members.name: RecordCountInfo

members.document: The record list result.
members.name: RecordList

members.document:
Domain level.
+ Original plan. Valid values: `D_FREE` (Free Plan); `D_PLUS` (Individual Plus Plan); `D_EXTRA` (Enterprise 1 Plan); `D_EXPERT` (Enterprise 2 Plan); `D_ULTRA` (Enterprise 3 Plan).
+ New plan. Valid values: `DP_FREE` (Free Version); `DP_PLUS` (Professional); `DP_EXTRA` (Enterprise Basic); `DP_EXPERT` (Enterprise); `DP_ULTRA` (Ultimate).
members.name: DomainGrade

members.document: Record type, which is obtained through the record type API. The value contains uppercase letters, such as `A`.
members.name: RecordType

members.document: Record split zone, which is obtained through the record split zone API.
members.name: RecordLine

members.document: Record value, such as `IP : 200.200.200.200`, `CNAME : cname.dnspod.com`, and `MX : mail.dnspod.com`.
members.name: Value

members.document: The record ID. You can view all DNS records and their IDs via the `DescribeRecordList` API.
members.name: RecordId

members.document: The domain ID. `DomainId` takes priority over `Domain`. If `DomainId` is passed in, `Domain` is ignored. You can view all `Domain` and `DomainId` values via the `DescribeDomainList` API.
members.name: DomainId

members.document: Host record such as `www`. If it is not passed in, it will be `@` by default.
members.name: SubDomain

members.document: Split zone ID, which is obtained through the record split zone API. The value is a string such as `10=1`. The `RecordLineId` parameter has a higher priority than `RecordLine`. If both of them are passed in, `RecordLineId` will be used first.
members.name: RecordLineId

members.document: MX priority, which is required for an MX record and will take effect if the record type is MX. Value range: 1–20.
members.name: MX

members.document: TTL. Value range: 1–604800. The minimum value varies by domain level.
members.name: TTL

members.document: Weight information, which is an integer between 0 and 100. It is supported only for enterprise VIP domains. `0` indicates not to pass in this parameter, i.e., not to set the weight.
members.name: Weight

members.document: Initial status of the record. Valid values: ENABLE, DISABLE. Default value: ENABLE. If `DISABLE` is passed in, the DNS record won't take effect, and the limit on round-robin DNS won't be verified.
members.name: Status

members.document:
D-Monitor status of the record.
"Ok" : The server is normal.
"Warn" : There is an alarm on this record, and the server returns 4XX.
"Down" : The server is down.
"" : D-Monitor is disabled for this record.
